name: Lateral Rows on Cable, One Armed
how_to_perform:
# To perform Lateral Rows on Cable, One Armed:

1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the end of a cable machine's strap in one hand.
2. Hold the weight or end of the strap with your hand and arm extended out to the side at shoulder height, about at a 90-degree angle from your body.
3. Keep your core engaged and your body upright.
4. Slowly pull the strap towards your hip with your hand and arm, keeping your elbow close to your body.
5. Focus on contracting your latissimus dorsi muscle as you perform this movement.
6. Pause briefly at the top of the movement and then slowly return to the starting position.
7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions. Perform repetitions in the opposite direction with your other arm.
short_summary: Lateral rows on cable, one armed is a unilateral exercise that isolates the latissimus dorsi muscle and provides an intense workout for your back muscles
